pageContext.claim: “Since 1976, Presidents have declared 59 national emergencies. They often involved protecting foreign citizens in far-off lands, yet Congress has not terminated any of them. Every single one of them is still in existence.”
pageContext.analysis: Just because Congress did not terminate a national emergency does not mean it is still in existence. Only 31 of the national emergencies that were declared prior to Trump's most recent remain in effect.
